node.statement: MODIFIED CAUCHY-SCHWARZ APPROACH. Since omega_1'(nu_k) = 1 for all k, the Key Lemma from original Strategy 3 becomes trivially: sum_k u_k^2 * 1 = Phi_n(p) (equality, not inequality). Try instead: by Cauchy-Schwarz, (sum h_k * u_k)^2 <= (sum h_k^2)(sum u_k^2) = Phi_n(r)*Phi_n(p), so <h,u>^2 <= Phi_n(r)*Phi_n(p). Since u = h + alpha, <h,u> = ||h||^2 + <h,alpha>. If <h,alpha> >= 0 then ||h||^4 <= <h,u>^2 <= Phi_n(r)*Phi_n(p). Similarly ||h||^4 <= Phi_n(r)*Phi_n(q). Multiplying: ||h||^8 <= Phi_n(r)^2 * Phi_n(p) * Phi_n(q), i.e., Phi_n(r)^2 <= Phi_n(p)*Phi_n(q). But this gives AB >= 0, NOT AB >= ||h||^4. Need a STRONGER bound.
